title: FTSE 100 loses ground as exporters slip, Rolls-Royce topples
text:
FTSE 100 loses ground as exporters slip, Rolls-Royce topples

Stock Markets 36 minutes ago (Sep 20, 2019 08:46)

(Reuters) - Britain's top share index edged lower on Friday as exporter stocks weakened on the back of a firmer sterling, driven by rising hopes of a Brexit deal, and Rolls-Royce (LON: ) tumbled after longer-than-expected repairs of its Trent 1000 engines. The slipped 0.3% by 0715 GMT, while the domestically-focussed inched 0.2% higher. Hopes of a Brexit deal after European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said on Thursday that one was possible, helped the pound extend overnight gains against the dollar to a two-month high. Dollar-earners such as Unilever (LON: ) and HSBC weighed on the main index. Rolls-Royce lost 3.3% after the engine-maker said it expects problems with its Trent 1000 engines to take longer to fix.
